1.text: Therefore you are inexcusable, O man, whoever you are that judge: for wherein you judge another, you condemn yourself; for you that judge do the same things.

2.text: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

3.text: And think you this, O man, that judge them which do such things, and do the same, that you shall escape the judgment of God?

4.text: Or despise you the riches of his goodness and forbearance and long-suffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leads you to repentance?

5.text: But after your hardness and impenitent heart treasure up to yourself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

6.text: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:

7.text: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honor and immortality, eternal life:

8.text: But to them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,

9.text: Tribulation and anguish, on every soul of man that does evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;

10.text: But glory, honor, and peace, to every man that works good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:

11.text: For there is no respect of persons with God.

12.text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;

13.text: (For not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

14.text: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law to themselves:

15.text: Which show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)

16.text: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

17.text: Behold, you are called a Jew, and rest in the law, and make your boast of God,

18.text: And know his will, and approve the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

19.text: And are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,

20.text: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which have the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.

21.text: You therefore which teach another, teach you not yourself? you that preach a man should not steal, do you steal?

22.text: You that say a man should not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? you that abhor idols, do you commit sacrilege?

23.text: You that make your boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonor you God?

24.text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.

25.text: For circumcision truly profits, if you keep the law: but if you be a breaker of the law, your circumcision is made uncircumcision.

26.text: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

27.text: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfill the law, judge you, who by the letter and circumcision do transgress the law?

28.text: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:

29.text: But he is a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit, and not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.
